text: The , also known as , is Japan's self-regulatory film regulator. Eirin was established on the model of the now-defunct American Motion Picture Producers and Distributors Association's Production Code Administration in June 1949, succeeding the US-led occupation authorities' role of film censorship during the Occupation of Japan. It classifies films into one of four categories depending on their suitability for viewing by minors of different ages. ==Ratings== G - Anyone can watch. PG-12 - Anyone can watch, but it's not recommended for viewers under 12 R15+ - Must be over 15. R18+ - Must be over 18. title: Eirin
